sen.j: 八文字屋 自笑（はちもんじや じしょう、生年不詳 - 延享2年11月11日 (旧暦)（1745年12月3日））は、浮世草子作者、版元。
sen.e: Jisho HACHIMONJIYA (year of birth unknown - December 3, 1745) was a Ukiyozoshi (Literally, Books of the Floating World) writer and hanmoto (publisher).

sen.j: 姓は安藤、京都の書肆八文字屋八左衛門の2代目か3代目。
sen.e: His family name was Ando, and he was the second or third generation of publisher Hachizaemon HACHIMONJIYA in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 「八左衛門」は読み方不明。用語集を参考に「Hachizaemon」としました。

sen.j: 元禄初年ころ家業を継ぎ、絵入狂言本を出板した。
sen.e: He took over his family business around 1688 and published Kyogen (farce played during a Noh cycle) books with illustration.

sen.e: From around 1696, he affiliated with Kiseki EJIMA, the ghost-writer.

sen.e: けいせい色三味線' and '役者口三味線' written by Kiseki became the basis of hyoban-ki (books of public estimation on various matters) of actors and Ukiyozoshi.

sen.j: 1710年頃から其磧と不和になるが、1718年和解、その後は板元となる。
sen.e: He came to a rupture with Kiseki from around 1710, they reconciled in 1718 and then he became Kiseki's publisher.
sen.cmt: 「板元」は「版元」と解釈して訳しました。

sen.j: 1735年の其磧没後は多田南嶺を作者とし、八文字屋本として知られる浮世草子を板行した。
sen.e: After the death of Kiseki in 1735, he published Ukiyozoshi written by Nanrei TADA, which were known as Hachimonjiya-bon (books published by the Hachimonjiya).
